triplets: Electronic device designed for capturing still images or videos, ranging from compact cameras to professional DSLRs and mirrorless systems
Photography, videography, surveillance, content creation, scientific imaging, and documentation
Metal, plastic, glass, electronic circuits, lenses, LCD/LED screens, and rubber grips
Lens for focusing light onto the sensor
Image sensor (CMOS or CCD) for capturing light
Viewfinder or screen for framing shots
Buttons, dials, and menus for controlling settings
Battery compartment and memory card slot
Varies depending on manufacturer and model; commonly black, silver, or gray
Photography equipment, multimedia kits, and professional imaging setups
Various manufacturers including Canon, Nikon, Sony, Fujifilm, Panasonic, and others
Approximately 0.3–2 kg depending on type and accessories
Approximately 5–15 cm depending on model and design
Typically 5–10 years depending on usage, maintenance, and technology updates
